solution_line_template: The ticket costs {regular_ticket_price} - {child_discount} = $<<{regular_ticket_price}-{child_discount}={child_ticket_price}>>{child_ticket_price} for each child.
So the ticket cost of the two children is {child_ticket_price} x {num_children} = $<<{child_ticket_price}*{num_children}={total_child_tickets}>>{total_child_tickets}.
The couple needs to pay the regular price, so it's {regular_ticket_price} x {num_adults} = $<<{regular_ticket_price}*{num_adults}={total_adult_tickets}>>{total_adult_tickets}.
Thus, the family needs to pay a total of {total_child_tickets} + {total_adult_tickets} = $<<{total_child_tickets}+{total_adult_tickets}={total_payment}>>{total_payment}.
